column4: dear all, my 'unlock' button of 'time and date settings' is disabled, why?
you are the main (first) user of this ubuntu?
the user you created while installing ubuntu
then i am sorry, but have no idea :|
there is not many things that really do require a reboot, its maybe worth a try but.... i dont believe so
you talk about rightclicking on the clock in the upper right corner, adujust date&time, set system time by the way?
i'm not so sure, but for me it looks like your user could lack sudo rights, which i dont believe. you have other problems like this when doing system updates, installs etc?
i could use sudo in the terminal
assumed so :\ well, maybe for now, use other means to change your time setup? what do you want to achive?
yeah. i want to see why the button disabled.
